00086 #define EQUIPMENT_COMMON_STR "\
00087 Event ID = WORD : 0\n\
00088 Trigger mask = WORD : 0\n\
00089 Buffer = STRING : [32] SYSTEM\n\
00090 Type = INT : 0\n\
00091 Source = INT : 0\n\
00092 Format = STRING : [8] FIXED\n\
00093 Enabled = BOOL : 0\n\
00094 Read on = INT : 0\n\
00095 Period = INT : 0\n\
00096 Event limit = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00097 Num subevents = DWORD : 0\n\
00098 Log history = INT : 0\n\
00099 Frontend host = STRING : [32] \n\
00100 Frontend name = STRING : [32] \n\
00101 Frontend file name = STRING : [256] \n\
00102 Status = STRING : [256] \n\
00103 Status color = STRING : [32] \n\
00104 "

00106 #define EQUIPMENT_STATISTICS_STR "\
00107 Events sent = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00108 Events per sec. = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00109 kBytes per sec. = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00110 "

00113 /********************************************************************/
00114 INT register_equipment(void)
00115 {
00116    INT index, size, status;
00117    char str[256];
00118    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00119    EQUIPMENT_STATS *eq_stats;
00120    HNDLE hKey;
00121 
00122    /* get current ODB run state */
00123    size = sizeof(run_state);
00124    run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00125    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/State", &run_state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
00126    size = sizeof(run_number);
00127    run_number = 1;
00128    status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
00129    assert(status == SUCCESS);
00130 
00131    /* scan EQUIPMENT table from mevb.C */
00132    for (index = 0; equipment[index].name[0]; index++) {
00133       eq_info = &equipment[index].info;
00134       eq_stats = &equipment[index].stats;
00135 
00136       if (eq_info->event_id == 0) {
00137          printf("\nEvent ID 0 for %s not allowed\n", equipment[index].name);
00138          cm_disconnect_experiment();
00139          ss_sleep(5000);
00140          exit(0);
00141       }
00142 
00143       /* init status */
00144       equipment[index].status = EB_SUCCESS;
00145 
00146       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Common", equipment[index].name);
00147 
00148       /* get last event limit from ODB */
00149       if (eq_info->eq_type != EQ_SLOW) {
00150          db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00151          size = sizeof(double);
00152          if (hKey)
00153             db_get_value(hDB, hKey, "Event limit", &eq_info->event_limit, &size, TID_DOUBLE, TRUE);
00154       }
00155 
00156       /* Create common subtree */
00157       status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, EQUIPMENT_COMMON_STR, TRUE);
00158       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00159          printf("Cannot check equipment record, status = %d\n", status);
00160          ss_sleep(3000);
00161       }
00162       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00163 
00164       if (equal_ustring(eq_info->format, "FIXED"))
00165          equipment[index].format = FORMAT_FIXED;
00166       else                      /* default format is MIDAS */
00167          equipment[index].format = FORMAT_MIDAS;
00168 
00169       gethostname(eq_info->frontend_host, sizeof(eq_info->frontend_host));
00170       strcpy(eq_info->frontend_name, frontend_name);
00171       strcpy(eq_info->frontend_file_name, frontend_file_name);
00172 
00173       /* set record from equipment[] table in frontend.c */
00174       db_set_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO), 0);
00175 
00176       /* get record once at the start equipment info */
00177       size = sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO);
00178       db_get_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, &size, 0);
00179 
00180     /*---- Create just the key , leave it empty ---------------------------------*/
00181       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Variables", equipment[index].name);
00182       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
00183       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00184       equipment[index].hkey_variables = hKey;
00185 
00186     /*---- Create and initialize statistics tree -------------------*/
00187       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Statistics", equipment[index].name);
00188 
00189       status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, EQUIPMENT_STATISTICS_STR, TRUE);
00190       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00191          printf("Cannot create/check statistics record, error %d\n", status);
00192          ss_sleep(3000);
00193       }
00194 
00195       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00196       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00197          printf("Cannot find statistics record, error %d\n", status);
00198          ss_sleep(3000);
00199       }
00200 
00201       eq_stats->events_sent = 0;
00202       eq_stats->events_per_sec = 0;
00203       eq_stats->kbytes_per_sec = 0;
00204 
00205       /* open hot link to statistics tree */
00206       status = db_open_record(hDB, hKey, eq_stats, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_STATS)
00207                               , MODE_WRITE, NULL, NULL);
00208       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00209          cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment",
00210                 "Cannot open statistics record, error %d. Probably other FE is using it", status);
00211          ss_sleep(3000);
00212       }
00213 
00214     /*---- open event buffer ---------------------------------------*/
00215       if (eq_info->buffer[0]) {
00216          status = bm_open_buffer(eq_info->buffer, 2 * MAX_EVENT_SIZE, &equipment[index].buffer_handle);
00217          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
00218             cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment",
00219                    "Cannot open event buffer. Try to reduce EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE in midas.h \
00220           and rebuild the system.");
00221             return 0;
00222          }
00223 
00224          if (1)
00225            {
00226              int level = 0;
00227              bm_get_buffer_level(equipment[index].buffer_handle, &level);
00228              printf("Buffer %s, level %d, info: \n", eq_info->buffer, level);
00229            }
00230 
00231          /* set the default buffer cache size */
00232          bm_set_cache_size(equipment[index].buffer_handle, 0, SERVER_CACHE_SIZE);
00233       } else {
00234          cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment", "Destination buffer must be present");
00235          ss_sleep(3000);
00236          exit(0);
00237       }
00238    }
00239    return SUCCESS;
00240 }
00241 
00242 /********************************************************************/
00243 INT load_fragment(void)
00244 {
00245    INT i, size, type;
00246    HNDLE hEqKey, hSubkey;
00247    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00248    KEY key;
00249    char buffer[NAME_LENGTH];
00250    char format[8];
00251 
00252    /* Get equipment pointer, only one eqp for now */
00253    eq_info = &equipment[0].info;
00254 
00255    /* Scan Equipment/Common listing */
00256    if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "Equipment", &hEqKey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00257       cm_msg(MINFO, "load_fragment", "Equipment listing not found");
00258       return EB_ERROR;
00259    }
00260 
00261    /* Scan the Equipment list for fragment info collection */
00262    for (i = 0, nfragment = 0;; i++) {
00263       db_enum_key(hDB, hEqKey, i, &hSubkey);
00264       if (!hSubkey)
00265          break;
00266       db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
00267       if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
00268          /* Equipment name */
00269          if (debug)
00270             printf("Equipment name:%s\n", key.name);
00271          /* Check if equipment is EQ_EB */
00272          size = sizeof(INT);
00273          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/type", &type, &size, TID_INT, 0);
00274          size = sizeof(buffer);
00275          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Buffer", buffer, &size, TID_STRING, 0);
00276          size = sizeof(format);
00277          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Format", format, &size, TID_STRING, 0);
00278          /* Check if equipment match EB requirements */
00279          //      if (debug)
00280          //  printf("Equipment name: %s, Type: 0x%x, Buffer: %s, Format: %s\n", 
00281          //       key.name, type, buffer, format);
00282          if ((type & EQ_EB)
00283              && (strncmp(buffer, buffer_name, strlen(buffer_name)) == 0)
00284              && (strncmp(format, eq_info->format, strlen(format)) == 0)) {
00285             /* match=> fill internal eb structure */
00286             strcpy(ebch[nfragment].format, format);
00287             strcpy(ebch[nfragment].buffer, buffer);
00288             size = sizeof(WORD);
00289             db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Trigger Mask", &ebch[nfragment].trigger_mask, &size, TID_WORD,
00290                          0);
00291             size = sizeof(WORD);
00292             db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Event ID", &ebch[nfragment].event_id, &size, TID_WORD, 0);
00293             printf("Fragment %d: Equipment name %s,  evID %d, buffer %s\n",nfragment,key.name, ebch[nfragment].event_id, buffer);
00294             //      printf("Fragment %d: Equipment name %s,  evID %d, buffer %s\n",key.name, ebch[nfragment].event_id, buffer);
00295             nfragment++;
00296          }
00297       }
00298    }
00299 
00300    if (nfragment > 1)
00301       printf("Found %d fragments for event building\n", nfragment);
00302    else
00303       printf("Found one fragment for event building\n");
00304 
00305    /* Point to the Ebuilder settings */
00306    /* Set fragment_add function based on the format */
00307    if (equipment[0].format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00308       meb_fragment_add = eb_mfragment_add;
00309    else {
00310       cm_msg(MERROR, "load_fragment", "Unknown data format :%d", format);
00311       return EB_ERROR;
00312    }
00313 
00314    /* allocate destination event buffer */
00315    dest_event = (char *) malloc(nfragment * (max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)));
00316    memset(dest_event, 0, nfragment * (max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)));
00317    if (dest_event == NULL) {
00318       cm_msg(MERROR, "load_fragment", "%s: Not enough memory for event buffer", frontend_name);
00319       return EB_ERROR;
00320    }
00321    return EB_SUCCESS;
00322 }
00323 
00324 /********************************************************************/
00325 INT scan_fragment(void)
00326 {
00327    INT fragn, status;
00328    EQUIPMENT *eq;
00329    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00330    INT ch;
00331 
00332    /* Get equipment pointer, only one eqp for now */
00333    eq_info = &equipment[0].info;
00334    status = 0;
00335    eq = NULL;
00336 
00337    /* Main event loop */
00338    do {
00339       switch (run_state) {
00340       case STATE_STOPPED:
00341       case STATE_PAUSED:
00342          /* skip the source scan and yield */
00343          status = cm_yield(500);
00344          if (wheel) {
00345             printf("...%c Snoring\r", bars[i_bar++ % 4]);
00346             fflush(stdout);
00347          }
00348          break;
00349       case STATE_RUNNING:
00350          status = source_scan(equipment[0].format, eq_info);
00351          switch (status) {
00352          case BM_ASYNC_RETURN: // No event found for now, Check for timeout 
00353 
00354            if (1) {
00355              /* advanced checking for timeouts */
00356 
00357              time_t now = time(NULL);
00358              int empty = 1;
00359              int badfrag = -1;
00360 
00361              /* check if we recieved any data */
00362              for (fragn = 0; fragn < nfragment; fragn++)
00363                if (ebset.received[fragn])
00364                  empty = 0;
00365 
00366              /* only look for timeout if there is received data from any fragment */
00367              if (!empty)
00368                for (fragn = 0; fragn < nfragment; fragn++) {
00369                  //if (debug)
00370                  //  printf("frag %d, timeout %d, threshold %d, received %d, time %d\n", fragn, ebch[fragn].timeout, TIMEOUT, ebset.received[fragn], now - ebch[fragn].time);
00371                  if (ebch[fragn].time && ebch[fragn].timeout)
00372                    if (now - ebch[fragn].time > TIMEOUT_ABORT) {
00373                      //cm_msg(MERROR, "scan_fragment", "frag %d, timeout %d, %d sec", fragn, ebch[fragn].timeout, now - ebch[fragn].time);
00374                      badfrag = fragn;
00375                    }
00376                }
00377 
00378              if (badfrag >= 0) {
00379                //status = SS_ABORT;
00380                if (!waiting_for_stop && !stop_requested) {
00381                  cm_msg(MERROR, "scan_fragment", "timeout waiting for fragment %d, restarting run", badfrag);
00382                  cm_msg(MINFO, "scan_fragment", "spawning mtransition");
00383                  ss_system("mtransition STOP IF \"/Logger/Auto restart\" DELAY \"/Logger/Auto restart delay\" START &");
00384                  waiting_for_stop = TRUE;
00385                }
00386                break;
00387              }
00388            }
00389 
00390             for (fragn = 0; fragn < nfragment; fragn++) {
00391                if (ebch[fragn].timeout > TIMEOUT) {     /* Timeout */
00392                   if (stop_requested) { /* Stop */
00393                      if (debug)
00394                         printf("Timeout waiting for fragment %d while stopping the run\n", fragn);
00395                      status = close_buffers();
00396                      break;
00397                   } else {
00398                      /* No stop requested  but timeout, allow a yield to not
00399                         eat all the CPU */
00400                      status = cm_yield(10);
00401                      if (wheel) {
00402                         printf("...%c Timing on %1.0lf\r", bars[i_bar++ % 4], eq->stats.events_sent);
00403                         fflush(stdout);
00404                      }
00405 
00406                   }
00407                }
00408                //else { /* No timeout loop back */
00409             }                   // for loop over all fragments
00410             break;
00411          case EB_ERROR:
00412          case EB_USER_ERROR:
00413             abort_requested = TRUE;
00414             if (status == EB_USER_ERROR)
00415                cm_msg(MTALK, "scan_fragment", "%s: Error signaled by user code - stopping run...",
00416                       frontend_name);
00417             else
00418                cm_msg(MTALK, "EBuilder", "%s: Event mismatch - Stopping run...", frontend_name);
00419 
00420             if (debug)
00421                printf("Stop requested on Error %d\n", status);
00422             close_buffers();
00423 
00424 #if 0
00425             if (!waiting_for_stop && !stop_requested) {
00426               cm_msg(MINFO, "scan_fragment", "spawning mtransition");
00427               //ss_system("mtransition STOP IF \"/Logger/Auto restart\" DELAY \"/Logger/Auto restart delay\" START &");
00428               ss_system("mtransition STOP &");
00429               waiting_for_stop = TRUE;
00430             }
00431 #endif
00432             for (ch=0; ch<5; ch++) {
00433                if (cm_transition(TR_STOP, 0, NULL, 0, SYNC, 0) == CM_SUCCESS)
00434                   break;
00435                cm_msg(MERROR, "scan_fragment", "%s: Stop Transition request failed, trying again!", frontend_name);
00436             }
00437             return status;
00438             break;
00439          case EB_SUCCESS:
00440          case EB_SKIP:
00441             //   Normal path if event has been assembled
00442             //   No yield in this case.
00443             break;
00444          default:
00445             cm_msg(MERROR, "scan_fragment", "unexpected return %d", status);
00446             status = SS_ABORT;
00447          }                      // switch scan_source
00448          break;
00449       }
00450       /* EB job done, update statistics if its time */
00451       /* Check if it's time to do statistics job */
00452       if ((actual_millitime = ss_millitime()) - last_time > 1000) {
00453          /* Force event to appear at the destination if Ebuilder is remote */
00454          rpc_flush_event();
00455          /* Force event ot appear at the destination if Ebuilder is local */
00456          bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, ASYNC);
00457 
00458          status = cm_yield(10);
00459 
00460          eq = &equipment[0];
00461          eq->stats.events_sent += eq->events_sent;
00462          eq->stats.events_per_sec = eq->events_sent / ((actual_millitime - last_time) / 1000.0);
00463          eq->stats.kbytes_per_sec = eq->bytes_sent / 1024.0 / ((actual_millitime - last_time) / 1000.0);
00464          eq->bytes_sent = 0;
00465          eq->events_sent = 0;
00466          /* update destination statistics */
00467          db_send_changed_records();
00468          /* Keep track of last ODB update */
00469          last_time = ss_millitime();
00470       }
00471 
00472       ch = 0;
00473       if (ss_kbhit()) {
00474          ch = ss_getchar(0);
00475          if (ch == -1)
00476             ch = getchar();
00477          if ((char) ch == '!')
00478             break;
00479       }
00480    } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
00481 
00482    return status;
00483 }
00484 
00485 /********************************************************************/
00486 INT eb_mfragment_add(char *pdest, char *psrce, INT * size)
00487 {
00488    BANK_HEADER *psbh, *pdbh;
00489    char *psdata, *pddata;
00490    INT bksize;
00491 
00492    /* Condition for new EVENT the data_size should be ZERO */
00493    *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00494 
00495    /* destination pointer */
00496    pddata = pdest + *size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00497 
00498    if (*size) {
00499       /* NOT the first fragment */
00500 
00501       /* Swap event source if necessary */
00502       psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00503       bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
00504 
00505       /* source pointer */
00506       psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00507       psdata = (char *) (psbh + 1);
00508 
00509       /* copy all banks without the bank header */
00510       bksize = psbh->data_size;
00511 
00512       /* copy */
00513       memcpy(pddata, psdata, bksize);
00514 
00515       /* update event size */
00516       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += bksize;
00517 
00518       /* update bank size */
00519       pdbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest) + 1);
00520       pdbh->data_size += bksize;
00521 
00522       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00523    } else {
00524       /* First event without the event header but with the 
00525          bank header as the size is zero */
00526       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce)->data_size;
00527 
00528       /* Swap event if necessary */
00529       psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00530       bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
00531 
00532       /* copy first fragment */
00533       memcpy(pddata, psbh, *size);
00534 
00535       /* update destination event size */
00536       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size = *size;
00537    }
00538    return CM_SUCCESS;
00539 }
00540 
00541 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00542 INT eb_yfragment_add(char *pdest, char *psrce, INT * size)
00543 {
00544    /* pdest : EVENT_HEADER pointer
00545       psrce : EVENT_HEADER pointer
00546       Keep pbkh for later incrementation
00547     */
00548    char *psdata, *pddata;
00549    DWORD *pslrl, *pdlrl;
00550    INT i4frgsize, i1frgsize, status;
00551 
00552    /* Condition for new EVENT the data_size should be ZERO */
00553    *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00554 
00555    /* destination pointer skip the header as it has been already
00556       composed and the usere may have modified it on purpose (Midas Control) */
00557    pddata = pdest + *size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00558 
00559    /* the Midas header is present for logger */
00560    if (*size) {                 /* already filled with a fragment */
00561 
00562       /* source pointer: number of DWORD (lrl included) */
00563       pslrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00564 
00565       /* Swap event if necessary */
00566       status = md_event_swap(FORMAT_MIDAS, pslrl);
00567 
00568       /* copy done in bytes, do not include LRL */
00569       psdata = (char *) (pslrl + 1);
00570 
00571       /* copy size in I*4 (lrl included, remove it) */
00572       i4frgsize = (*pslrl);
00573       i1frgsize = 4 * i4frgsize;
00574 
00575       /* append fragment */
00576       memcpy(pddata, psdata, i1frgsize);
00577 
00578       /* update Midas header event size */
00579       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += i1frgsize;
00580 
00581       /* update LRL size (I*4) */
00582       pdlrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest) + 1);
00583       *pdlrl += i4frgsize;
00584 
00585       /* Return event size in bytes */
00586       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00587    } else {                     /* new destination event */
00588       /* The composed event has already the MIDAS header.
00589          which may have been modified by the user in ebuser.c
00590          Will be stripped by the logger (YBOS).
00591          Copy the first full event ( no EVID suppression )
00592          First event (without the event header) */
00593 
00594       /* source pointer */
00595       pslrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00596 
00597       /* Swap event if necessary */
00598       status = md_event_swap(FORMAT_MIDAS, pslrl);
00599 
00600       /* size in byte from the source midas header */
00601       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce)->data_size;
00602 
00603       /* copy first fragment */
00604       memcpy(pddata, (char *) pslrl, *size);
00605 
00606       /* update destination Midas header event size */
00607       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += *size;
00608 
00609    }
00610    return CM_SUCCESS;
00611 }
00612 
00613 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00614 INT tr_start(INT rn, char *error)
00615 {
00616    EBUILDER(ebuilder_str);
00617    INT status, size, i;
00618    char str[128];
00619    KEY key;
00620    HNDLE hKey, hEqkey, hEqFRkey;
00621    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00622 
00623    if (debug)
00624      printf("tr_start: run %d\n", rn);
00625 
00626    eq_info = &equipment[0].info;
00627 
00628    /* Get update eq_info from ODB */
00629    sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Common", equipment[0].name);
00630    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00631    size = sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO);
00632    db_get_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, &size, 0);
00633 
00634    ebset.nfragment = nfragment;
00635 
00636    /* reset serial numbers */
00637    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
00638       equipment[i].serial_number = 1;
00639       equipment[i].subevent_number = 0;
00640       equipment[i].stats.events_sent = 0;
00641       equipment[i].odb_in = equipment[i].odb_out = 0;
00642    }
00643 
00644    /* Get / Set Settings */
00645    sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Settings", equipment[0].name);
00646    if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hEqkey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00647       status = db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(ebuilder_str));
00648    }
00649 
00650    /* Keep Key on Ebuilder/Settings */
00651    sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Settings", equipment[0].name);
00652    if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hEqkey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00653       cm_msg(MINFO, "tr_start", "/Equipment/%s/Settings not found", equipment[0].name);
00654    }
00655 
00656    /* Update or Create User_field */
00657    size = sizeof(ebset.user_field);
00658    status = db_get_value(hDB, hEqkey, "User Field", ebset.user_field, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00659 
00660    /* Update or Create User_Build */
00661    size = sizeof(ebset.user_build);
00662    status = db_get_value(hDB, hEqkey, "User Build", &ebset.user_build, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
00663 
00664    /* update ODB */
00665    size = sizeof(INT);
00666    status = db_set_value(hDB, hEqkey, "Number of Fragment", &ebset.nfragment, size, 1, TID_INT);
00667 
00668    /* Create or update the fragment request list */
00669    status = db_find_key(hDB, hEqkey, "Fragment Required", &hEqFRkey);
00670    status = db_get_key(hDB, hEqFRkey, &key);
00671    assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
00672 
00673    if (key.num_values != ebset.nfragment) {
00674       cm_msg(MINFO, "tr_start", "Number of Fragment mismatch ODB:%d - CUR:%d", key.num_values, ebset.nfragment);
00675       free(ebset.preqfrag);
00676       size = ebset.nfragment * sizeof(BOOL);
00677       ebset.preqfrag = malloc(size);
00678       for (i = 0; i < ebset.nfragment; i++)
00679          ebset.preqfrag[i] = TRUE;
00680       status =
00681          db_set_value(hDB, hEqkey, "Fragment Required", ebset.preqfrag, size, ebset.nfragment, TID_BOOL);
00682    } else {                     // Take from ODBedit
00683       size = key.total_size;
00684       free(ebset.preqfrag);
00685       ebset.preqfrag = malloc(size);
00686       status = db_get_data(hDB, hEqFRkey, ebset.preqfrag, &size, TID_BOOL);
00687    }
00688    /* Cleanup fragment flags */
00689    free(ebset.received);
00690    ebset.received = malloc(size);
00691    for (i = 0; i < ebset.nfragment; i++)
00692       ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
00693 
00694    /* Check if at least one fragment is requested */
00695    for (i = 0; i < ebset.nfragment; i++)
00696       if (ebset.preqfrag[i])
00697          break;
00698 
00699    if (i == ebset.nfragment) {
00700       cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_start", "Run start aborted because no fragment required");
00701       return 0;
00702    }
00703 
00704    /* Call BOR user function */
00705    status = eb_begin_of_run(run_number, ebset.user_field, error);
00706    if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
00707       cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_start", "run start aborted due to eb_begin_of_run (%d)", status);
00708       return status;
00709    }
00710 
00711    /* Book all fragment */
00712    status = source_booking();
00713    if (status != SUCCESS)
00714       return status;
00715 
00716    if (!eq_info->enabled) {
00717       cm_msg(MINFO, "tr_start", "Event Builder disabled");
00718       return CM_SUCCESS;
00719    }
00720 
00721    /* local run state */
00722    run_state = STATE_RUNNING;
00723    run_number = rn;
00724    stop_requested = FALSE;
00725    abort_requested = FALSE;
00726    printf("%s-Starting New Run: %d\n", frontend_name, rn);
00727 
00728    if (1) {
00729      int fragn;
00730      time_t now = time(NULL);
00731      
00732      // reset timeouts
00733      for (fragn = 0; fragn < nfragment; fragn++) {
00734        ebch[fragn].time = now;
00735        ebch[fragn].timeout = 0;
00736      }
00737    }
00738 
00739    /* Reset global trigger mask */
00740    return CM_SUCCESS;
00741 }
00742 
00743 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00744 INT tr_resume(INT rn, char *error)
00745 {
00746   int fragn;
00747   time_t now = time(NULL);
00748 
00749    printf("\n%s-Resume Run: %d detected\n", frontend_name, rn);
00750 
00751    // reset timeouts
00752    for (fragn = 0; fragn < nfragment; fragn++) {
00753      ebch[fragn].time = now;
00754      ebch[fragn].timeout = 0;
00755    }
00756 
00757    run_state = STATE_RUNNING;
00758    return CM_SUCCESS;
00759 }
00760 
00761 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00762 INT tr_pause(INT rn, char *error)
00763 {
00764    printf("\n%s-Pause Run: %d detected\n", frontend_name, rn);
00765 
00766    run_state = STATE_PAUSED;
00767    return CM_SUCCESS;
00768 }
00769 
00770 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00771 INT tr_stop(INT rn, char *error)
00772 {
00773    waiting_for_stop = FALSE;
00774 
00775    if (debug)
00776      printf("tr_stop: run %d\n", rn);
00777 
00778    /* local stop */
00779    stop_requested = TRUE;
00780 
00781    /* local stop time */
00782    request_stop_time = ss_millitime();
00783    return CM_SUCCESS;
00784 }
00785 
00786 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00787 void free_event_buffer(INT nfrag)
00788 {
00789    INT i;
00790    for (i = 0; i < nfrag; i++) {
00791       if (ebch[i].pfragment) {
00792          free(ebch[i].pfragment);
00793          ebch[i].pfragment = NULL;
00794       }
00795    }
00796 }
00797 
00798 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00799 INT handFlush()
00800 {
00801    int i, size, status;
00802    char strout[256];
00803 
00804    /* Do Hand flush until better way to  garantee the input buffer to be empty */
00805    if (debug)
00806       printf("Hand flushing system buffer... \n");
00807    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00808       do { 
00809          status = 0;
00810          if (ebset.preqfrag[i]) {
00811             size = max_event_size;
00812             status = bm_receive_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].pfragment, &size, ASYNC);
00813             if (debug1) {
00814                sprintf(strout,
00815                        "booking:Hand flush bm_receive_event[%d] hndle:%d stat:%d  Last Ser:%d",
00816                        i, ebch[i].hBuf, status, ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number);
00817                printf("%s\n", strout);
00818             }
00819          }
00820       } while (status == BM_SUCCESS);
00821    }
00822 
00823    /* Empty source buffer */
00824    status = bm_empty_buffers();
00825    if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
00826       cm_msg(MERROR, "handFlush", "bm_empty_buffers failure [%d]", status);
00827    run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00828    return status;
00829 }
00830 
00831 
00832 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00833 INT source_booking()
00834 {
00835    INT j, i, status, status1, status2;
00836 
00837    if (debug)
00838       printf("Entering booking\n");
00839 
00840    status1 = status2 = 0;
00841 
00842    /* Book all the source channels */
00843    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00844       /* Book only the requested event mask */
00845       if (ebset.preqfrag[i]) {
00846          /* Connect channel to source buffer */
00847          status1 = bm_open_buffer(ebch[i].buffer, 2 * MAX_EVENT_SIZE, &(ebch[i].hBuf));
00848 
00849          if (debug)
00850             printf("bm_open_buffer frag:%d buf:%s handle:%d stat:%d\n",
00851                    i, ebch[i].buffer, ebch[i].hBuf, status1);
00852 
00853          if (1)
00854            {
00855              int level = 0;
00856              bm_get_buffer_level(ebch[i].hBuf, &level);
00857              printf("Buffer %s, level %d, info: \n", ebch[i].buffer, level);
00858            }
00859 
00860 
00861          /* Register for specified channel event ID and Trigger mask */
00862          status2 =
00863              bm_request_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].event_id,
00864                               TRIGGER_ALL, GET_ALL, &ebch[i].req_id, NULL);
00865          if (debug)
00866             printf("bm_request_event frag:%d id:%d msk:%d req_id:%d stat:%d\n",
00867                    i, ebch[i].event_id, ebch[i].trigger_mask, ebch[i].req_id, status2);
00868          if (((status1 != BM_SUCCESS) && (status1 != BM_CREATED)) ||
00869              ((status2 != BM_SUCCESS) && (status2 != BM_CREATED))) {
00870             cm_msg(MERROR, "source_booking",
00871                    "Open buffer/event request failure [%d %d %d]", i, status1, status2);
00872             return BM_CONFLICT;
00873          }
00874 
00875          /* allocate local source event buffer */
00876          if (ebch[i].pfragment)
00877             free(ebch[i].pfragment);
00878          ebch[i].pfragment = (char *) malloc(max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
00879          if (debug)
00880             printf("malloc pevent frag:%d pevent:%p\n", i, ebch[i].pfragment);
00881          if (ebch[i].pfragment == NULL) {
00882             free_event_buffer(nfragment);
00883             cm_msg(MERROR, "source_booking", "Can't allocate space for buffer");
00884             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
00885          }
00886       }
00887    }
00888 
00889    /* Empty source buffer */
00890    status = bm_empty_buffers();
00891    if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
00892       cm_msg(MERROR, "source_booking", "bm_empty_buffers failure [%d]", status);
00893       return status;
00894    }
00895 
00896    if (debug) {
00897       printf("bm_empty_buffers stat:%d\n", status);
00898       for (j = 0; j < ebset.nfragment; j++) {
00899          printf(" buff:%s", ebch[j].buffer);
00900          printf(" ser#:%d", ebch[j].serial);
00901          printf(" hbuf:%2d", ebch[j].hBuf);
00902          printf(" rqid:%2d", ebch[j].req_id);
00903          printf(" opst:%d", status1);
00904          printf(" rqst:%d", status2);
00905          printf(" evid:%2d", ebch[j].event_id);
00906          printf(" tmsk:0x%4.4x\n", ebch[j].trigger_mask);
00907       }
00908    }
00909 
00910    return SUCCESS;
00911 }
00912 
00913 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00914 INT source_unbooking()
00915 {
00916    INT i, status;
00917 
00918    /* unbook all source channels */
00919    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00920 
00921    /* Skip unbooking if already done */
00922       if (ebch[i].pfragment != NULL) {
00923          bm_empty_buffers();
00924 
00925          /* Remove event ID registration */
00926          status = bm_delete_request(ebch[i].req_id);
00927          if (debug)
00928             printf("unbook: bm_delete_req[%d] req_id:%d stat:%d\n", i, ebch[i].req_id, status);
00929 
00930          /* Close source buffer */
00931          status = bm_close_buffer(ebch[i].hBuf);
00932          if (debug)
00933             printf("unbook: bm_close_buffer[%d] hndle:%d stat:%d\n", i, ebch[i].hBuf, status);
00934          if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
00935             cm_msg(MERROR, "source_unbooking", "Close buffer[%d] stat:", i, status);
00936             return status;
00937          }
00938       }
00939    }
00940 
00941    /* release local event buffer memory */
00942    free_event_buffer(nfragment);
00943 
00944    return EB_SUCCESS;
00945 }
00946 
00947 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00948 INT close_buffers(void)
00949 {
00950    INT status;
00951    char error[256];
00952    EQUIPMENT *eq;
00953 
00954    eq = &equipment[0];
00955 
00956    /* Flush local destination cache */
00957    bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, SYNC);
00958    /* Call user function */
00959    eb_end_of_run(run_number, error);
00960    /* Cleanup buffers */
00961    handFlush();
00962    /* Detach all source from midas */
00963    status = source_unbooking();
00964 
00965    /* Compose message */
00966    stop_time = ss_millitime() - request_stop_time;
00967    sprintf(error, "Run %d Stop after %1.0lf + %d events sent DT:%d[ms]",
00968            run_number, eq->stats.events_sent, eq->events_sent, stop_time);
00969    cm_msg(MINFO, "close_buffers", "%s", error);
00970 
00971    run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00972    abort_requested = FALSE;
00973    return status;
00974 }
00975 
00976 /********************************************************************/
00977 /**
00978 Scan all the fragment source once per call.
00979 
00980 -# This will retrieve the full midas event not swapped (except the
00981 MIDAS_HEADER) for each fragment if possible. The fragment will
00982 be stored in the channel event pointer.
00983 -# if after a full nfrag path some frag are still not cellected, it
00984 returns with the frag# missing for timeout check.
00985 -# If ALL fragments are present it will check the midas serial#
00986 for a full match across all the fragments.
00987 -# If the serial check fails it returns with "event mismatch"
00988 and will abort the event builder but not stop the run for now.
00989 -# If the serial check is passed, it will call the user_build function
00990 where the destination event is going to be composed.
00991 
00992 @param fmt Fragment format type 
00993 @param eq_info Equipement pointer
00994 @return   EB_NO_MORE_EVENT, EB_COMPOSE_TIMEOUT
00995 if different then SUCCESS (bm_compose, rpc_sent error)
00996 */
00997 INT source_scan(INT fmt, EQUIPMENT_INFO * eq_info)
00998 {
00999    static DWORD serial;
01000    DWORD *plrl;
01001    BOOL complete;
01002    INT i, status, size;
01003    INT act_size;
01004    BOOL found, event_mismatch;
01005    BANK_HEADER *psbh;
01006 
01007    status = 0;
01008 
01009    /* Scan all channels at least once */
01010    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01011       /* Check if current channel needs to be received */
01012       if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && !ebset.received[i]) {
01013          /* Get fragment and store it in ebch[i].pfragment */
01014          size = max_event_size;
01015          status = bm_receive_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].pfragment, &size, ASYNC);
01016          //printf("call bm_receive_event from %s, serial %d, status %d\n", ebch[i].buffer, serial, status);
01017          switch (status) {
01018          case BM_SUCCESS:      /* event received */
01019             /* Mask event */
01020             ebset.received[i] = TRUE;
01021             /* Keep local serial */
01022             ebch[i].serial = ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number;
01023             /* clear timeout */
01024             ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01025             ebch[i].time = time(NULL);
01026 
01027             /* Swap event depending on data format */
01028             switch (fmt) {
01029             case FORMAT_MIDAS:
01030                psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment) + 1);
01031                bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
01032                break;
01033             }
01034 
01035             if (debug1) {
01036                printf("SUCC: ch:%d ser:%d rec:%d sz:%d\n", i, ebch[i].serial, ebset.received[i], size);
01037             }
01038             break;
01039          case BM_ASYNC_RETURN: /* timeout */
01040             ebch[i].timeout++;
01041             if (debug1) {
01042               printf("ASYNC: ch:%d ser:%d rec:%d sz:%d, timeout:%d\n", i, ebch[i].serial, ebset.received[i], size, ebch[i].timeout);
01043             }
01044             //return status;
01045             break;
01046          default:              /* Error */
01047             cm_msg(MERROR, "source_scan", "bm_receive_event error %d", status);
01048             return status;
01049             break;
01050          }
01051       }                         /* next channel */
01052    }
01053 
01054    /* Check if all fragments have been received */
01055    complete = FALSE;
01056    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01057       if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && !ebset.received[i])
01058          break;
01059    }
01060    if (i == nfragment) {
01061       complete = TRUE;
01062       /* Check if serial matches */
01063       found = event_mismatch = FALSE;
01064       serial = 0;
01065       /* Check Serial, mark first serial */
01066       for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01067          if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && ebset.received[i] && !found) {
01068             serial = ebch[i].serial;
01069             found = TRUE;
01070          } else {
01071             if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && ebset.received[i] && (serial != ebch[i].serial)) {
01072                /* Event mismatch */
01073                event_mismatch = TRUE;
01074             }
01075          }
01076       }
01077 
01078       /* internal action in case of event mismatch */
01079       if (event_mismatch && debug) {
01080          char str[256];
01081          char strsub[128];
01082          strcpy(str, "event mismatch: ");
01083          for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01084             sprintf(strsub, "Ser[%d]:%d ", i, ebch[i].serial);
01085             strcat(str, strsub);
01086          }
01087          printf("event serial mismatch %s\n", str);
01088       }
01089 
01090       /* In any case reset destination buffer */
01091       memset(dest_event, 0, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01092       act_size = 0;
01093 
01094       /* Fill reserved header space of destination event with
01095          final header information */
01096       bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event, eq_info->event_id, eq_info->trigger_mask,
01097                        act_size, serial);
01098 
01099       /* Pass fragments to user with mismatch flag, for final check before assembly */
01100       status =
01101           eb_user(nfragment, event_mismatch, ebch, (EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event,
01102                   (void *) ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event + 1), &act_size);
01103       if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01104          if (status == EB_SKIP) {
01105             /* Reset mask and timeouts as if event has been successfully send out */
01106             for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01107                ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01108                ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
01109             }
01110          }
01111          return status;         // Event mark as EB_SKIP or EB_ABORT by user
01112       }
01113 
01114       /* Allow bypass of fragment assembly if user did it on its own */
01115       if (!ebset.user_build) {
01116          for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01117             if (ebset.preqfrag[i]) {
01118                status = meb_fragment_add(dest_event, ebch[i].pfragment, &act_size);
01119                if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01120                   cm_msg(MERROR, "source_scan",
01121                          "compose fragment:%d current size:%d (%d)", i, act_size, status);
01122                   return EB_ERROR;
01123                }
01124             }
01125          }
01126       }
01127 
01128       /* Overall event to be sent */
01129       act_size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01130 
01131       /* Send event and wait for completion */
01132       status = rpc_send_event(equipment[0].buffer_handle, dest_event, act_size, SYNC, 0);
01133       if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01134          if (debug)
01135             printf("rpc_send_event returned error %d, event_size %d\n", status, act_size);
01136          cm_msg(MERROR, "source_scan", "%s: rpc_send_event returned error %d", frontend_name, status);
01137          return EB_ERROR;
01138       }
01139 
01140       /* Keep track of the total byte count */
01141       equipment[0].bytes_sent += act_size;
01142 
01143       /* update destination event count */
01144       equipment[0].events_sent++;
01145 
01146       /* Reset mask and timeouts as even thave been succesfully send */
01147       for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01148          ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01149          ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
01150       }
01151    }                            // all fragment recieved for this event
01152 
01153    return status;
01154 }
01155 
01156 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01157 int main(int argc, char **argv)
01158 {
01159    INT status, size, rstate;
01160    int i;
01161    BOOL daemon = FALSE;
01162    HNDLE hEqkey;
01163    EBUILDER(ebuilder_str);
01164    char str[128];
01165    int auto_restart = 0;
01166    int restart_count = 0;
01167 
01168    /* init structure */
01169    memset(&ebch[0], 0, sizeof(ebch));
01170 
01171    /* set default */
01172    cm_get_environment(host_name, sizeof(host_name), expt_name, sizeof(expt_name));
01173 
01174    /* set default buffer name */
01175    strcpy(buffer_name, "SYSTEM");
01176 
01177    /* get parameters */
01178    for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
01179       if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd')
01180          debug = TRUE;
01181       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'D')
01182          daemon = TRUE;
01183       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'w')
01184          wheel = TRUE;
01185       else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
01186          if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
01187             goto usage;
01188          if (strncmp(argv[i], "-e", 2) == 0)
01189             strcpy(expt_name, argv[++i]);
01190          else if (strncmp(argv[i], "-h", 2) == 0)
01191             strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
01192          else if (strncmp(argv[i], "-b", 2) == 0)
01193             strcpy(buffer_name, argv[++i]);
01194       } else {
01195        usage:
01196          printf("usage: mevb [-h <Hostname>] [-e <Experiment>] [-b <buffername>] [-d] [-w] [-D]\n");
01197          printf("  [-h <Hostname>]    Host where midas experiment is running on\n");
01198          printf("  [-e <Experiment>]  Midas experiment if more than one exists\n");
01199          printf("  [-b <buffername>]  Specify evnet buffer name, use \"SYSTEM\" by default\n");
01200          printf("  [-d]               Print debugging output\n");
01201          printf("  [-w]               Show wheel\n");
01202          printf("  [-D]               Start as a daemon\n");
01203          return 0;
01204       }
01205    }
01206 
01207    // Print SVN revision
01208    strcpy(str, mevb_svn_revision+12);
01209    if (strchr(str, ' '))
01210       *strchr(str, ' ') = 0;
01211    printf("Program mevb, revision %s from ", str);
01212    strcpy(str, mevb_svn_revision+17);
01213    if (strchr(str, ' '))
01214       *strchr(str, ' ') = 0;
01215    printf("%s. Press \"!\" to exit.\n", str);
01216 
01217    if (daemon) {
01218       printf("Becoming a daemon...\n");
01219       ss_daemon_init(FALSE);
01220    }
01221 
01222    /* Connect to experiment */
01223    status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, expt_name, frontend_name, NULL);
01224    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
01225       ss_sleep(5000);
01226       goto exit;
01227    }
01228 
01229    if (debug)
01230       cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, 0);
01231 
01232    /* Connect to ODB */
01233    status = cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
01234    if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01235       ss_sleep(5000);
01236       goto exit;
01237    }
01238 
01239    /* check if Ebuilder is already running */
01240    status = cm_exist(frontend_name, FALSE);
01241    if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
01242       cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "%s running already!.", frontend_name);
01243       cm_disconnect_experiment();
01244       goto exit;
01245    }
01246 
01247    /* Check if run in progess if so abort */
01248    size = sizeof(rstate);
01249    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/State", &rstate, &size, TID_INT, FALSE);
01250    if (rstate != STATE_STOPPED) {
01251       cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "Run in Progress, EBuilder aborted!.");
01252       cm_disconnect_experiment();
01253       goto exit;
01254    }
01255 
01256    if (ebuilder_init() != SUCCESS) {
01257       cm_disconnect_experiment();
01258       /* let user read message before window might close */
01259       ss_sleep(5000);
01260       goto exit;
01261    }
01262 
01263    /* Register single equipment */
01264    status = register_equipment();
01265    if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01266       ss_sleep(5000);
01267       goto exit;
01268    }
01269 
01270    /* Load Fragment info */
01271    status = load_fragment();
01272    if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01273       ss_sleep(5000);
01274       goto exit;
01275    }
01276 
01277    /* Register transition for reset counters */
01278    if (cm_register_transition(TR_START, tr_start, 400) != CM_SUCCESS)
01279       return status;
01280    if (cm_register_transition(TR_RESUME, tr_resume, 400) != CM_SUCCESS)
01281       return status;
01282    if (cm_register_transition(TR_PAUSE, tr_pause, 600) != CM_SUCCESS)
01283       goto exit;
01284    if (cm_register_transition(TR_STOP, tr_stop, 600) != CM_SUCCESS)
01285       goto exit;
01286 
01287  restart:
01288 
01289    /* Set Initial EB/Settings */
01290    sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Settings", equipment[0].name);
01291    if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hEqkey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
01292       status = db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(ebuilder_str));
01293    }
01294 
01295    if (auto_restart && restart_count > 0)
01296      {
01297        int run_number = 0;
01298        int size = sizeof(run_number);
01299        status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
01300        assert(status == SUCCESS);
01301 
01302        cm_msg(MINFO, frontend_name, "Restart the run!");
01303 
01304        cm_transition(TR_START, run_number+1, NULL, 0, SYNC, 0);
01305      }
01306      
01307    /* initialize ss_getchar */
01308    ss_getchar(0);
01309 
01310    /* Scan fragments... will stay in */
01311    status = scan_fragment();
01312    printf("%s-Out of scan_fragment\n", frontend_name);
01313 
01314    /* Detach all source from midas */
01315    printf("%s-Unbooking\n", frontend_name);
01316    source_unbooking();
01317 
01318    ebuilder_exit();
01319 
01320    auto_restart = 0;
01321    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Auto restart", &auto_restart, &size, TID_BOOL, FALSE);
01322 
01323    cm_msg(MINFO, frontend_name, "evb exit status %d, auto_restart %d", status, auto_restart);
01324 
01325    if (status == EB_USER_ERROR)
01326      {
01327        restart_count ++;
01328        goto restart;
01329      }
01330 
01331    /* reset terminal */
01332    ss_getchar(TRUE);
01333 
01334  exit:
01335    /* Free local memory */
01336    free_event_buffer(ebset.nfragment);
01337 
01338    /* Clean disconnect from midas */
01339    cm_disconnect_experiment();
01340    return 0;
01341 }
